Course Name: Not sure if BOB U Certification is right for you?

Description: Ive added a couple extra photos so you can see what a finished square shaped haircut looks like on a real client.
Make sure to take a look at the Perfect Bob Head sheet over to the right

The final step in this cut is the fringe. The techniques used will make cutting a fringe so easy and really make a huge difference in the finished results. Also, I know I said there was a style video on this cut, But I have not done that yet. We can cover some styling of a lob in a live zoom session.

then so we go through that whole side and do the same thing and then we'll end up with the same situation as the other side right here behind the ear I'm just just extending back and connecting to the graduation created back there and that's looking good to go now we'll come down this left side here just so you guys can see I just wanted you guys to see both sides of that how that worked out now I've got the corner on both sides I need to take off and match up to the back which again still needs that length we're gonna clean that length up so we just use the comb control and bring that hair down also we're gonna do some pull it in the fingers as well just to kind of elevate it away from the face just a little bit and that is good right the jawline will take that length off now and honestly I'm probably gonna go in like at the very end with like a clipper on the neckline just to like really get that nice like tidy finish at the neckline which I do on clients as well from time to time so don't be afraid to grab your trimmers and just really tidy in that neckline if you really want that kind of a sharper look at the nape but right now we're just using comb control and just kind of taking it off getting not pulling with the comb just holding the hair in place so I remember try not to pull the hair down cause it will spring back up on you and it's looking really good we just need to obviously finish the hair there at the nape and like I said I probably gonna go back in the end of this and do a clipper on the neck just to make it really nice and sharp back there like you up that neckline area but you see that that way of cutting that way of connecting with doing the front first in the back second just just kind of a different way to approach it and now we're just going through and removing some weight through the back mainly the front doesn't bother me so much the back just very heavy back here and just need to tidy that tidy that up with some texturizing taking that weight out we're kind of doing that at a yeah about about a 45 degree angle there so again it's an aggressive weight removal taking those little sort of triangles out of the hair we just went all the way around the head but you see that that design lines really great it's got that nice graduation the whole way around and it's looking really good now and it's just got a nice little kind of boxy shape to this kind of perimeter which is a great structure to have down there okay so we just took a horizontal parting now from like basically straight across the crown like I divided the crown in half so this is the front half of the crown and then this is the back half of the crown that drops down to the occipital bone there so we've got this kind of like half circle so we've got a line there and then a curvature down there so like a half circle section okay and then this is what we're gonna use we'll use this to connect to the bottom half that we've cut the perimeter so we'll again pulling that hair out kind of square from the head and then connecting so you can see what this is doing this is kind of building some shape kind of on the back end of this haircut and then as Course Name: Live # 2 - Winona Ryder Iconic 90s Bob Breakdown
Description: Winona Ryder's iconic 90s bob breakdown // Covers concepts including core sectioning, client consult tips, traditional approach and modern approaches to texturizing techniques.

CLICK HERE to watch the layering workshop: LINK



Synopsis:



If layering has ever felt confusing—especially on thick hair—this workshop will change how you cut forever.



You’ll learn how to:





Create a sleek, controlled concave shape



Use internal layering to add movement without losing fullness



Style layered cuts with a modern, contoured smooth-iron finish

This technique instantly upgrades your work, boosts your confidence behind the chair, and gives your clients that polished, high-end result they’re seeing on Pinterest (shags, wolf cuts, butterfly cuts).
